required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Tial of Er:YAG Laser Snoring Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Different Modes of Er:YAG Laser Treatment for Snoring in Comparison With Placebo
clinical_study.source: Cooperativa de Ensino Superior, Politécnico e Universitário

brief_summary.textblock: Two modes of laser (Er:YAG) treatment for snoring will be compared with sham treatment in a randomized clinical trial.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the clinical outcome of snoring treatment using non-ablative Er:YAG laser in comparison with sham laser treatment. Furthermore, to different modes of Er:YAG laser will be compared; a long-pulse mode (LP) and proprietary SMOOTH mode (Fotona, Slovenia).

study_design_info.masking_description: Sham treatment consists of laser treatment according to the same protocol as active treatment but with no energy applied. Clinical measurements will be performed by an evaluator unaware of group assignment.

primary_outcome.measure: NightLase Snoring Questionnaire-Question 1: Snoring severity change from baseline
primary_outcome.description: This questionnaire consists of eight questions, assessing the severity of snoring (the first question) and other problems associated with sleep-disordered breathing (questions 2-8). Answers will be graded on 11-point scales (0-10) .

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in snoring value
secondary_outcome.description: Snorelab software used to record snoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EpWorth somnolence scale from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The level of daytime sleepiness in the patients was assessed using the 24-point Epworth scale. Values 0-10 are considered normal, and values 11-24 represent increasing levels of 'excessive daytime sleepiness'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in EpWorth somnolence scale from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life Questionnaire score from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Oral Health Impact Profile-14 on the scale from 0 to 56 with higher scores indicating a poorer oral health-related quality of life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Apnea - Hypopnea Index (AHI) from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by polysomnography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in O2 saturation (%) from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by polysomnography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in snoring time (mean duration of episode in s) from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by polysomnography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in percentage snoring time of total sleep time (%) from baseline.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by polysomnography.

arm_group.description: Fotona SMOOTH mode Er:YAG laser snoring treatment.
Sham laser snoring treatment with no energy applied.

intervention.description: LP Er:YAG applied to oral mucosa
SMOOTH mode Er:YAG applied to oral mucosa
Er:YAG laser applied to oral mucosa with no energy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed Informed consent form
- Diagnosis of snoring/apnea including partner information
- Age greater than 18 years.
- Apnea-Hypopnea index (AHI) less than 30.
- No significant nasal stenosis.
- Bed partner present
Exclusion Criteria:
- People who refuse to participate in the study
- Presence of concomitant disorders and/or diseases
- Infections in the throat
- current use of photosensitive drugs
- pregnancy
- scarring in the throat
- acute pollen allergies
- epilepsy
- People starting with an extreme diet or weight loss plan
- Patients who do not want to follow post treatment recommendation concerning food and drinks intake
- Larynx obstruction (floppy epiglottis)
- Oropharynx obstruction caused by palatine tonsils (>50%).
